result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin S Stewart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Restitution and Surcharges and Court Costs.

supervisions.notes:
If Revoked:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 113 days sentence credit, if revoked.
Concurrent with: Case 15CF1564.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.

Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
Concurrent with: Cases 14CF1564 and 15CF363.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution to be paid as follows:  $55 payable to Kwik Trip, $673.85 payable to Walmart and $250.83 to Woodman's.  Restitution is to be paid BEFORE costs or fines and to be paid as a Condition of Probation (within the first 2 years).

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Defendant to remain at the transitional living center as long as deemed appropriate.
No contact with any victim/businesses/co-actors listed in the criminal complaint or read in lists.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Defendant to contact Probation by 09:00 a.m. on 03-30-2016.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all standard release conditions.
STAYED - To be used at Agents discretion.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Letter from court to defendant denying his request to reinstate huber; Judge Dreyfus will not intervene.

From defendant received 6/10/16 requesting to be allowed Huber.

6/21/16 - Court denied defendant's request to reinstate Huber.
It is ordered that the defendant's huber privileges are hereby revoked until the defendant's behavior is deemed appropriate for confinement at the Huber Facility.
Letter dated June 2, 2016 from Jail Administration requesting huber privileges be revoked until defendant's behaivor is deemed appropriate for confinement at the Huber Facility.
Response letter from court denying defendant's request for sentence credit or any modification of sentence.
Filed by the Defendant, requesting the court order the credit time stayed if he is revoked be applied to his condition time.
Approved and signed by the Court:  Defendant to serve 125 days Huber with all standard release conditions as condition time in the Waukesha County Jail for said Defendant's non-compliance.
Letter dated May 3, 2016, filed by Department of Corrections, requesting condition time be imposed with proposed order for commitment for condition time for non-compliance with probation conditions.

Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Kevin S Stewart in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.



Court orders the following:  
Total Prison: 3.5 Years.
Initial Confinement:  1.5 Years.
Extended Supervision: 2 Years.
113 Days Credit - IF REVOKED.
Concurrent to:  Case 15CF1564
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.


Term of Probation:  3 Years.
Court will allow for transferred to Milwaukee County.
Concurrent to:  case 15CF1564 & 15CF363
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Defendant to remain at the transitional living center as long as deemed appropriate.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  any victim/businesses/co-actors listed in the compliant or read in lists.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Defendant to contact Probation by 9 am. tomorrow (03/30/16).

RESTITUTION:  $979.68 (Breakdown:  $55 Kwik Trip, $673.85 WalMart & $250.83 to Woodman's - restitution to be paid before costs or fines) - To be paid in full within the first 2 years of probation.
Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Apply bail to the restitution.
Balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME:
125 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
STAYED - To be used at the agents discretion.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
